document_title: Excess estrogen: Signs, causes and prevention
subsection_content:
1. Eat whole grains
A diet rich in whole grains can reduce estrogen levels in the body and prevent some cancers related to excess estrogen. Whole grains contain abundant fiber, which helps the body absorb cholesterol (a precursor to estrogen). This will help limit the metabolic effects of estrogen production from excess fat tissue in the body, helping to balance estrogen.
2. Eat lots of fruits and vegetables
Natural fresh vegetables and fruits help promote natural estrogen balance in the body, reducing excess estrogen levels. Some vegetables you should add to your diet include kiwi, mango, grapes, apples, grapefruit, strawberries, blueberries, bananas, oranges, luffa, sweet potatoes, potatoes, carrots, onions. , olive oil…
3. Limit red meat intake
Red meats contain a lot of protein. When you eat too much of this type of meat, your blood estrogen levels risk increasing, exacerbating hormonal imbalance. You need to stay away from foods that are harmful to your health such as:
Red meat: Beef, goat meat, lamb, dog meat, horse meat...; Prepared foods: Sausages, bacon, frozen meat...; Refined grain flour: White flour, white rice, white bread...; Artificial sweets: Cakes, pastries, carbonated drinks...
4. Good weight control
You should re-establish a scientific lifestyle. Patients need to work, eat, rest, and exercise at a reasonable frequency. This will help you control your weight, balance your hormones and maintain a toned figure. You should note:
Get enough sleep, about 6 - 8 hours a day; Provide enough water for the body, at least 2 liters/day; Spend time exercising, at least 30 minutes/day. You can start with simple exercises like walking, jogging, yoga, meditation, cycling...
5. Do not use alcohol or harmful stimulants
Alcohol, beer, cigarettes... cause many negative effects on health. Their abuse also makes estrogen imbalance worse and more difficult to control. Therefore, you need to stay away from harmful drinks and stimulants. Instead, patients should supplement beneficial drinks such as yogurt, unsweetened fresh milk, smoothies, fruit juice, etc.

High estrogen levels can increase the risk of health problems, including cancer. Therefore, when you notice the above symptoms or suspect that you have excess estrogen, you should go to the hospital for examination and related tests. From there, the doctor will provide timely intervention measures to avoid dangerous health complications.
